enum.description: UI Mode (Playwright Test Runner with Web UI)
Server (Playwright Test Runner without Web UI)

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Playwright.

attrs.label: User ID
attrs.description: The user id that Playwright files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Group ID
attrs.description: The group id that Playwright files will be owned by.

attrs.label: Port Bind Mode
attrs.description:
The port bind mode.</br>
- Publish: The port will be published on the host for external access.</br>
- Expose: The port will be exposed for inter-container communication.</br>
- None: The port will not be exposed or published.</br>
Note: If the Dockerfile defines an EXPOSE directive,
the port will still be exposed for inter-container communication regardless of this setting.

enum.description: Publish port on the host for external access

attrs.label: Host IPs
attrs.description: IPs on the host to bind this port

attrs.label: Playwright Working Directory
attrs.description: The path to store the Playwright test files.

ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

1.0.1.readme:
Playwright

Playwright is a testing framework for end-to-end testing of web applications. Playwright can automate user interactions in Chromium, Firefox and WebKit browsers with a single API.

chart_metadata.description: Playwright enables reliable end-to-end testing for modern web apps.
chart_metadata.name: playwright

run_as_context.description: Playwright runs as any non-root user.

chart_metadata.title: Playwright
